intro: Rinorea ilicifolia subsp. amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping rinorea, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that often wrap around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
